result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley Scott Van Engel S

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bradley Scott Van Engel S in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Bradley Scott Van Engel S.  Attorney Careen Marie Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in set for preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: City of Glendale Police Officer H. Sandler. State rests. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case is adjourned to Branch 02. Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 11-2-2022

Defendant Bradley Scott Van Engel S in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court on behalf of Attorney Colin McGinn for Bradley Scott Van Engel S.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Doctor's Report Return.  Attorney Colin McGinn in trial on another matter.  Attorney Romenesko informs the court that Mr. Van Engel does not contest the Doctor's report.  Signature bond previously set remains in place with Justice Point LEVEL 3 SUPERVISION.  Court ordered all previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.  Court reminds Mr. Van Engel of NO CONTACT with B.V.E and any family members.  Court scheduled a preliminary hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch PE, Rm 146 CJF.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-18-2022

Defendant Bradley Scott Van Engel S in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Bradley Scott Van Engel S.  Prosecuting Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Bradley Scott Van Engel S
Current: 2772 N Weil St, Milwaukee, WI 53212   (Effective: 06-17-2022)
Prior: 2763 North Bremen Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Bradley Scott Van Engel in court in person with Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn who appears by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defense would like time to meet with his client. State objects to an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No contact order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Bernard K. V E and any of his family members including, but not limited to, EV.

DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES THIS CASE WAS HEARD OFF THE RECORD.
Defendant Bradley Scott Van Engel in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Bradley Scott Van Engel in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bradley Scott Van Engel appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
